noun.description: A cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in the atmosphere at or near the earth's surface limiting visibility, but to a lesser extent than fog; strictly, with visibility remaining above 1.5 miles (1 km)
examples: the peaks were shrouded in mist
a mist rose out of the river

verb.description: Cover or become covered with mist.
examples: the windows were misted up with condensation
the glass was beginning to mist up

origin: Old English, of Germanic origin; from an Indo-European root shared by Greek omikhlē mist, fog.
